content.p: According to a recent national poll, 41% of females and 32% of males identify as democrats. Suppose a random sample of 120 females and 140 males is obtained.

body.p: What is the value of the parameters for the binomial random variable X, the number of democrats in the sample of 120 females?
n = (report your answer in whole numbers)
p = (report your answer to two decimal places)

response.feedback: Correct. X is a binomial random variable from an experiment with 120 independent trials, in this case 120 females.
Incorrect. It looks like you identified the number of independent trials for males.
Incorrect. Recall that n is the number of independent trials, in this case the number of females.
Correct. X is a binomial random variable from an experiment with a probability of “success” (being “democrat”) for females of 0.41.
Incorrect. It looks like you identified the probability of “success” (being “democrat”) for males.
Incorrect. It looks like you identified the probability of “failure” (not being “democrat”) for females.
Incorrect. Recall that p is the probability of “success” (being “democrat”) for females.
